alert.note: Alert for Extreme Western Allegany; Garrett (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 30 at 12:21AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...Lingering Snow Showers and Slick Spots Through Early Morning... Occasional snow showers will affect locations in and around Garrett and western Allegany counties in Maryland and western Mineral county in West Virginia. Additional accumulations of just over an inch are possible. Temperatures will continue to drop down into the upper 20s through the overnight along with winds gusting to 20-25 mph along the cold front passage. The combination of snow showers and gusty winds mean that there will be areas of blowing snow that reduce visibility below one-half mile at times. Be prepared for sudden changes in visibility when driving along with snow covered and slippery surfaces.
